About

About Me

My name is Alec Whyte. I'm 26 years old, I'm from Southern California, and I'm an aspiring software developer. My main programming language is Python, but I've used several different languages during my time in university for projects.

I studied Computer Science for three of my five years at the University of California, Irvine. I fell in love with coding my senior year of high school; my AP Computer Science teacher was incredibly engaging, and when I started to make words I typed appear on the screen or functions I made execute, I was hooked on this computer wizardry.

I studied a few different areas in my tenure at UCI; I wanted to get into CS, but it was a very impacted major. I started undeclared and then moved to Math. I like numbers and calculations, so math felt right as a fallback if I couldn't get into what I wanted. After two years waiting for an opportunity, I was finally allowed to start taking CS classes and eventually changed my major to Computer Science. I graduated in 2017 with a 3.4 GPA.

I currently work as an A/V technician for Encore Global. I help setup ballrooms and breakout rooms with screens, projectors, speakers, and cabling. I really like being a helpful person behind the scenes. I'm a quiet person, so being the support character in any instance is where I thrive.

Recently, I started to brush up on my skills to try and get a job that's more fulfilling for me. I like what I do, but I just have no passion for it. I'm not obsessed with audio or video like some of my coworkers. I just work there to make ends meet. I'd much rather be learning more about code and actually applying what I've learned. I've truly only just begun applying things I've studied. I have a web app published on pythonanywhere that took me two weeks to take from a simple API call in a python script to a functional site with a UI.

In my free time, I love to game. I'm very into single player RPGs, shooters, and puzzle games. I don't really like online multiplayer games besides RuneScape, but I play that alone. My favorite game of all time is Fallout: New Vegas; it is truly an incredible game. The perks, the dialogue, the companions, the story are just all excellent.

I'm also big into TTRPGs. I love to play Dungeons & Dragons with my friends! I've been playing for over 8 years at this point. Recently, we started to play Vampire: The Masquerade, and it's been really cool so far.

I play both guitar and bass for fun. I absolutely love music. Playing along with songs I like to listen to is always my go to when I pick up either instrument. I own a 7-string Sterling John Petrucci Signature electric guitar and a Fender Standard Precision Bass.
